title: Three New Figma Buzz Features Unlock Brand Momentum for Designers and Marketers

paragraphs.content: Figma announced three new features for Figma Buzz in December 2025: configurable marketing templates linked to design systems, plugin integrations for apps like DAM and TMS, and in-platform video trimming. These updates enable marketers to produce on-brand assets without external tools, using component properties for template variations and direct editing capabilities. Figma's official blog states, "we’re giving designers and marketers new tools to create branded assets that speak volumes."

paragraphs.content: The features address user feedback for deeper customization, reducing the need to manage hundreds of static variants. Marketers can now browse, switch, and customize templates while staying aligned with design systems. This builds on Buzz's beta launch at Config 2025, positioning it for scalable visual assets like social posts and emails.

sections.title: Configurable Templates Harness Design Systems for On-Brand Flexibility

paragraphs.content: Figma Buzz templates now leverage component properties, variants, booleans, and instance swaps to create flexible, on-brand options. Designers build these in Figma Design, publish them, and marketers configure layouts or toggle elements directly in Buzz without breaking brand guidelines. Auto-layout ensures elements adapt responsively, maintaining spacing as content changes.

paragraphs.content: Publishing is limited to five templates on Professional plans and unlimited on Organization or Enterprise plans. Users select from Figma-curated or team templates, with options for preset formats across platforms like Instagram and LinkedIn. This setup empowers non-designers to riff creatively while protecting design integrity.

sections.title: Plugin Integrations and Video Trimming Streamline Asset Workflows

paragraphs.content: Buzz now supports plugins for digital asset management like Brandfolder, translation via Lokalise, and animation with LottieFiles, allowing teams to animate headlines or interactions on-canvas. Users can create and publish internal or community plugins, tying into Figma’s Schema for programmatic management. Video trimming lets teams import MP4 or MOV files, trim precisely for collages or ads, and sync multiples without tool-switching.

paragraphs.content: These enhancements expand Buzz's ecosystem alongside 150+ 2025 features, including AI tools like image generation. Industry views position Buzz as a Canva competitor, bridging design-to-deployment for enterprise brands. Forrester notes it ensures consistency for companies with design systems, fostering hybrid creative roles.
